name: Extract meta tags
description:
Add URL as seed node and fetch data. The meta-tags are contained in the HTML body and tell you details about the page, such as the author of the page or the date of the last modification. 

This preset adds a child node for each meta tag.

Some  values follow predefined vocabularies, for example, defined in semantic web technology (RDF). You can identify these vocabularies from prefixes used in the name, e.g. the prefix "og:" stands for OpenGraph: <meta name="og:title" content="The Rock"/>. See https://ogp.me/

Many social media sites, when sharing links, generate webpage previews from the meta tags. Common schemes are https://ogp.me/ and https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/twitter-for-websites/cards/overview/abouts-cards

Meta tags usally have a name-property and a content-property. Sometimes a property-property instead of the name-property is used.

See https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_meta.asp
